title: Master Yi is way over powered
body:
{{champion:33}}  in defensive curl. 
{{item:3143}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3047}} {{item:1413}} {{item:3742}}  and starting to build {{item:3083}} 

Master Yi melted me in seconds. 1800 wuju style true damage. Teammates beating on him, he just lifesteals back all damage done to him. Any CC thrown at him and he uses alpha strike to avoid it. Any large nuke thrown at him and he meditates to reduce it to nothing. There was nothing we could do. Every fight the Yi just moves in and penta kills us while melting me easily. 

There is no way you can tell me this is in any way balanced. The ult lasts way too long. There is no reason to be doing true damage instead of physical. Alpha strike does not need 600 range. A melee champion should be just that, melee. Meditate should reduce defenses, not increase it. 

This champion is completely toxic to the game and needs major nerfs.

[https://imgur.com/a/ZqWjOsd](https://imgur.com/a/ZqWjOsd)

It's not that he's overpowered, there's no actual counterplay to his kit aside from "CC him", which applies to all champs. 

Because 100% of his damage comes from unavoidable AAs, there is no way to actually counter his damage. Especially considering Yi typically builds Bloodrazor and Guinsoo's, has true damage built into his kit and commonly runs Conqueror, it means that your armour purchases aren't as lucrative compared to against a champion like Tryndamere and Yasuo.

I have said this multiple times already, but since autoattacks are basically imppossible to miss, imposible to dodge, have no CD, and have no mana cost at all, they should never do burst damage.

Because what's the point of doing 600 damage with an skillshot when another champion can do 600 damage with and autoattack? This basically rewards autoattacks more tan anything else, and is the cause of things like crit damage been so massively broken so often.

There are other ways to counter him besides CC. [Look at his counters.](https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/MasterYi/)

Rammus - Master Yi only has a 44% chance of winning against this champion. Rammus is too tanky to deal with unless Master Yi gets early kills, which is unlikely because good Rammus players will beat him in 2v2 fights and gank a lot.

Shaco - There is nothing Master Yi can do against an invisible champion. Not to mention things like the boxes and clone really makes fights difficult for Yi. Shaco will usually invade and counterjungle Master Yi, and once he gets ahead he can just burst Master Yi when he's not expecting it.

Udyr - Undodgeable stun, active counterjungler and invader.

Kha'Zix - Lots of burst damage and invisibility.

Jax - Counterstrike.

Elise - Has a strong stun, a much stronger early game, and rappel makes her hard to kill.

Warwick - Tons of CC, also really drain-tanky while doing a lot of damage. 

Evelynn - Stealth, hard CC, and burst damage.

Pantheon - Reliable stun, tons of damage early game, and will usually snowball the game against Yi.

Graves - Tons of burst damage, he can kite Master Yi without Highlander, and his smokescreen is actually really good against Yi.

Taric - Can't get resets if the support won't die and his whole team is invincible for a few seconds.

Alistar - Tanky, with tons of hard CC.

Ahri - It's almost impossible for Master Yi to kill this champion. She's way more mobile than him when they both ult, and without ults, she just charms and kites.

Zilean - Revive makes it really hard to get the first reset.

Heimerdinger - It's really dangerous to engage on Heimerdinger.

Kayle - Instant invincibility ult is really hard to deal with, and she's a huge damage threat in her own right.

TL;DR Going tanky is almost never the best way to deal with Master Yi. Really it's a matter of denying him kills however you can, and killing him before he can kill you. Almost all champions in the game have tools to deal with Master Yi, whether it's mobility, stealth, untargetability, CC, or just a lot of damage.

Well, funnel is a bit of an exception. Is there any other yi playstyle which proves that he's 'overpowered'?

Danijrm hit challenger on NA at one point, and he's dropped to masters. 
Cowsep peaked in masters, but that was Philippines server, which just happens to not be one of the few big regions.

But that said, Yi is in a better spot now with conqueror than he was before. Broken? Don't think so. Probably where he should be right now. Meditate buffs - don't do much but he doesn't need them either. He's finally in a decent spot but people just want him to have sub 50 winrates because of the stigma on this champion. 

You don't counter Yi with micro, he has very little micro to manage so with that he is less likely to fuck up than you. You counter him with macroplay. Yi does not like grouping, especially with the duelist conqueror set up (which is why some Yi mains used to go crit, which sucks at duelling but is decent for teamfighting, or was anyway). A mistake people make is fighting him on his terms. 

You'd see a lone ADC walk up to try poke a Yi that had been splitpushing with a full stacked conqueror/guinsoo's, is that even smart? You wouldn't do that to a Zed, why the fuck would you try that on a Yi? With his Conq/6x Guinsoo? He's far more vulnerable without those, and typically won't survive long enough to stack them in a fight with the state of damage right now. This also means that he is far less likely to be flanking because he needs to be stacking himself somewhere and start the fight within 3 seconds - which typically means he'll be seen on the map.

He's a 1v1 god, but that's all he does, and he can still get outduelled by a Jax or Trynd (skill matchup). His pre-rageblade phase is shitty too, and very abusable by most junglers past level 2.

But even without see'ing it i can tell that Master Yi does too much _TRUE DAMAGE_ nowadays, an obvious counter to Yi is Rammus, and if even he can get melted by the ridiculours amounts of true damage (witnessed by myself) then it is just a testament to the approval of the overall true damage creep in this game being too high.
plenty of champions have been nerfed/reworked for being stat checks, and yet here we have master yi, the champion of all stat checks getting buffs and not being reworked

1) Master Yi has a [44% winrate against Rammus.](https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/MasterYi/) Rammus beats Master Yi, you just played the matchup wrong or he got lucky kills off your teammates. At a glance, it looks like your bottom lane fed him.

2) Master Yi cannot simply Alpha Strike every CC and kill everyone. Unless your team has like, 1 stun and no damage. Alpha Strike is used to dodge CC, but also to gapclose and avoid damage.

3) Meditate is only 50-70% damage reduction, and it's easily interrupted. He really can't tank that much with it.

4) That Master Yi was fed out of his mind and built all damage items, *of course* he melts your whole team.

5) Highlander only lasts 7 seconds until he gets a kill or assist. After that though, the duration can get pretty crazy - like 40 seconds. The base duration sucks compared to similar ultimates but the +7 for each kill/assist is too much.

6) Master Yi would be much more unbalanced if he dealt physical damage instead of true damage with Wuju Style. The damage would have to be higher (because that would be a huge nerf otherwise) and he would kill squishies almost instantly, while being totally unable to deal with tanks.

7) Alpha Strike need 600 range because he needs as much mobility as he can get. He's melee and he can't be tanking damage for very long.

8) He really can't lifesteal that much because a lot of his damage is actually coming from on-hit effects, which do not apply lifestal.

Your teamcomp could've very easily dealt with Master Yi. You have tons of CC and damage, and you had like 2 and a half tanks. Fun fact - Singed can counter Master Yi by using his glue, because Alpha Strike can't be used when you're grounded.
